question: How do you prefer to solve a problem?

options.label: A
options.text: By evaluating data and previous examples.

options.label: B
options.text: By brainstorming unusual or out-of-the-box ideas.

options.label: C
options.text: By discussing the issue and balancing different viewpoints.

question: In a group task, what role do you naturally take?

options.label: A
options.text: Organizer or timekeeper.

options.label: B
options.text: Idea generator or motivator.

options.label: C
options.text: Coordinator and communicator between roles.

question: When reading a book, you enjoy:

options.label: A
options.text: Analyzing the logic or plot mechanics.

options.label: B
options.text: Imagining the world and characters vividly.

options.label: C
options.text: Understanding how characters relate and evolve.

question: When planning a trip, what do you enjoy most?

options.label: A
options.text: Creating a detailed itinerary and budget.

options.label: B
options.text: Picking locations based on how exciting or beautiful they seem.

options.label: C
options.text: Balancing cost, comfort, and fun for everyone involved.

question: You're given a large project with a deadline. What do you do first?

options.label: A
options.text: Break it into steps and create a checklist.

options.label: B
options.text: Imagine the end result and start creatively sketching ideas.

options.label: C
options.text: Gather input from your team before deciding the approach.

question: When learning something new, you prefer to:

options.label: A
options.text: Follow a structured step-by-step approach.

options.label: B
options.text: Explore and experiment freely.

options.label: C
options.text: Learn through discussion and collaboration.

question: When making decisions, you rely most on:

options.label: A
options.text: Facts, data, and logical analysis.

options.label: B
options.text: Intuition and creative insights.

options.label: C
options.text: Input from others and consensus building.

question: In your ideal work environment, you would:

options.label: A
options.text: Prefer clear structure and defined processes.

options.label: B
options.text: Thrive in a flexible, creative atmosphere.

options.label: C
options.text: Enjoy collaborative team dynamics.

question: When facing a complex challenge, you:

options.label: A
options.text: Break it down into manageable parts systematically.

options.label: B
options.text: Look for innovative and unconventional solutions.

options.label: C
options.text: Seek diverse perspectives and team input.

question: Your approach to time management is:

options.label: A
options.text: Highly organized with detailed schedules.

options.label: B
options.text: Flexible, adapting to inspiration and energy.

options.label: C
options.text: Balanced between structure and spontaneity.

question: When working on a team project, you:

options.label: A
options.text: Focus on ensuring quality and meeting deadlines.

options.label: B
options.text: Bring fresh ideas and creative energy.

options.label: C
options.text: Facilitate communication and team harmony.

options.label: A
options.text: Reading textbooks and following detailed instructions.

options.label: B
options.text: Hands-on experimentation and discovery.

options.label: C
options.text: Group discussions and peer learning.

options.label: A
options.text: Feasibility and practical implementation.

options.label: B
options.text: Originality and creative potential.

options.label: C
options.text: Team consensus and stakeholder buy-in.

options.label: A
options.text: Help organize and categorize ideas.

options.label: B
options.text: Generate wild and unconventional ideas.

options.label: C
options.text: Encourage participation and build on others' ideas.

question: Your preferred way to approach a new subject is:

options.label: A
options.text: Start with fundamentals and build systematically.

options.label: B
options.text: Jump in and explore interesting aspects first.

options.label: C
options.text: Learn through examples and case studies.
